Description: Narrow ovoid jar of marl pottery with a small base, ledge rim and two pierced cylindrical handles on the shoulder; decorated in red-brown paint on each side with a many-oared boat, below which is a row of long-legged birds (ostriches) and a line of s-motifs. The handles are painted with diagonal strokes; below the handles on each side is a vertical row of s-motifs and a large skin on pole motif. The base is painted with cross-hatching and the rim with perpendicular strokes.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s Decorated ware. One boat has a Z-sign standard, the standard on the other boat is worn away. Published: C. Torr, Sur quelques pretendus navires egyptiens, L’Anthropologie 9 (1898), fig. 4ab G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 530.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
